inn1.comm: slight away movement, pitches on a good length and Amla leaves it alone, not much bounce
on a similar length, maybe just a  touch wider but still moves away, no shot offered
gets bat on it for the first time, he stays back and pushes it to mid-off
gets half forward this time and defends to the off side
bowls a similar line, moves it away outside off and Amla pushes this one to cover
keeps him on the back foot this time, bit shorter and he punches it wide of cover to get off the mark
not the best start for Mathews, the toss didn't go his way and neither does his first ball, half volley on the pads and clipped wide of midwicket for a boundary
drifts a bit on the pads and he works it down to square leg
a bit fuller and outside off and he gets a nice stride across and pushes it to mid-off
the slower one foxes him, full outside off and he chases it and gets an inside edge past the stumps
that was quite stylish, picks a full ball from outside off and uses his wrists well to work it hard wide of mid-on, the bat recoiled after he played it
he has him driving and missing, this one bounced a bit more and moved away
he gets on the back foot and punches it straight to cover
best of the lot so far, Amla shows how to play the back foot drive, length ball on middle and leg, shows the full face of the bat and places it well wide of mid-on
finds the gap again, a bit wide outside off and he punches it late, wide of backward point, Mahela chases and just pulls it back
fails to bash a full toss, came on quickly and he worked it straight to midwicket
searches for a yorker and it becomes a low full toss which he jams out to mid-off, Perera does well to slide to his left and cut it off one handed
he gets the yorker this time! Too quick for de Kock, he plays all around it, looks to play across the line, doesn't get the bat down and it hits the base of the middle stump
gets beside the line and pushes it down to point
this was banged in short and he swiveled to pull and ended up mistiming it to the leg side
this was full and wide outside off and he drives him down to cover
Duminy watchfully leaves this one alone, moves away
lands it a shade outside off and moves away and Duminy is happy to let it go
this was fuller and wider and Duminy doesn't offer a shot
spanked that, Malinga pitched it short outside off and Amla wasn't afraid of pulling this one, across the line and he middled it, past square leg
the bowler's not afraid to pitch it short again, shorter this time and Amla swiveled to pull and nearly gloved it, Malinga appeals confidently but no evidence it touched the glove
stays behind the line and pushes it to the off side
shapes it towards the stumps and he clips it down to mid-on
the short stuff is producing mixed results, this is not the quickest pitch and Amla is able to pick the length in time for the pull, sat up nicely and he plays it above square leg
another lovely shot, this time more effortless, stays beside the line and punches it neatly past backward point, fielders hardly moved
comes round the wicket and he lands it wide outside off and the ball keeps low before reaching the keeper
hits a good length outside off and he leaves it to the keeper
gets across the stumps and he tucks it down to mid-on
punishes the width, full and wide outside and he comes forward and across and slaps it wide of cover
stays beside the line and he leaves it alone
outside off and he looks to defend and he's struck on the pads, stifled appeal
starts off with a loosener on the pads and he works it to deep square leg, fielder stationed in the deep there
straighter one and he plonks forward and defends
drives a full delivery down to long-on, protection there too
the leg break this time, solidly punched this time to mid-off

almost a run out! Amla pushed it firmly wide of mid-off, called, set off and then suddenly changed his mind, Duminy would have gone had there been a direct hit, having said that Mendis should have stood behind the stumps to collect the throw
forward and chips it in the air towards long-on
tucks it towards midwicket for a quick single
fullish outside off and he pushes it to the off side
another poor delivery, too full and wide outside off, Duminy reaches out and slaps it wide of short cover who dives in vain
angles across and he leaves it alone
Duminy's driving well through the off side, too full and wide and he drives squarer this time, on the front foot, beats backward point
fuller and moving away and he leaves it alone
risks staying on the back foot and he pushes it back to the bowler
in the air but safe, Amla went forward and spooned it to the off side but he placed it well wide of mid-off, fastest 50 for SA in this series
clips it to the on side for a single
keeps low and he gets an inside edge past the stumps as he looks to cut
on the back foot this time and another inside edge, onto the pads
this time Duminy shows the full face and punches it down the track
another neat back foot punch by Amla, cannot beat cover though
Amla bats outside the crease and he gets forward and pushes a fuller one down to mid-off
he moves across and he works it to the on side
goes back and knocks it to the off side
stays beside the line and pushes it to the off side
keeps it straight and tight and he pushes it to the off side
on the back foot, waits for it and tucks it to square leg
comes forward and the ball lobs off the top flap of the pad and Sanga runs across and tries to catch it, doesn't take it, Herath appeals for an lbw
pushes it down to long-off
evidence of low bounce again, quicker and flatter and Duminy is beaten on the cut, Sanga fumbles
close call for SA, he worked it towards cover and set off, the fielder attacked the ball but failed to gather
drifts on the pads and he knocks it wide of square leg
class from Amla! It was a half volley outside off and Amla moved across the crease quickly to improvise, that shuffle helped Amla pick the gap in the deep at deep cover
moved across and he pushes it wide of cover
punched to the off side and Chandimal does well to slide at short extra cover
quick single, Duminy pushed this wide of mid-off and Herath gathered and had a shy at the bowler's end but Dumiuny was quick
uses his wrists and flicks it wide of square leg
stays back and punches it to long-on
tossed up and he comes well forward and defends
gives it more air and he comes well forward and clips it to mid-on
chips down the track and nearly yorks himself, digs it out to point
clips a full delivery to square leg
stays back and knocks it to square leg
Amla's really finding the gaps with ease, this was full and wide outside off and he played a neat square drive on the front foot to deep point,the sweeper couldn't cut it off
brings up his fifty! Poor bowling from Perera, he pitched it short and wide outside off and he slaps it to deep point, third man had no chance
on the pads and he clips it down to deep square leg
punched a full ball firmly and Mathews did well at mid-off to cut it off
stays back and clips it down to midwicket
Perera's having a tough time, lands it too full and Duminy drives straight down the ground, once again Mathews is sharp on the field, dives and pulls it back before the rope
tossed up and he comes forward and knocks it to the on side
tossed up and he comes forward and knocks it to midwicket
picks it from outside and easily guides it to deep midwicket
fuller delivery and driven down to long-off
moves right across his stumps and knocks it to midwicket
drives down the track and Dilshan does well to run to his right and save a run or two
goes back and knocks it to the on side
Herath tosses it up slowly and Amla plays a rare false shot, beaten on the drive, nearly edged it
moves across and he plays it close to his pads to the on side, Sanga appeals
pushes it down to long-off
tossed up and he clips it to midwicket for a single
quicker one and he works it away easily down to deep midwicket
drifts on the pads and he clips him wide of midwicket
once again keeps it on the pads and he works it to deep square leg
strays on the leg side again and he clips it to deep square leg
on the off stump and he stays back and defends
slow and low, Duminy stays back at the crease and dead bats it
the straighter one and he stays back and defends

overthrows! Beats as many as three fielders! Amla pushed that to mid-on and set off, Chandimal fired a flat throw wide of the stumps at the bowler's end, beats Herath and two others and finds the third man boundary
pushes it down to long-on
flatter delivery and worked wide of midwicket
tossed up and he comes well forward and drives to mid-off
clipped off the pads to the leg side
fullish on the pads and he drives to mid-on
flatter delivery and he defends forward
stays back and tucks it to square leg
flatter delivery and whipped firmly to the leg side
slower through the air and another easy single to the deep on the leg side
flatter and he comes forward and blocks it out
tossed up around off and he stays back and defends
moves across and pushes it to midwicket
gets across and whips it away wide of long-on
goes back and punches it straight to cover
slower through the air and he pushes it to the off side on the front foot
round the wicket to Amla, easily worked away to the deep
fuller one and he drives down to long-on
fullish outside off and pushed to the off side
this one keeps low, skids and beats Amla as he prods forward
elegantly played! Amla was down the track and angled the bat in such a way that he chipped it as straight as possible, one bounce and four
quicker one and he works it to midwicket
stays back and knocks it to mid-on
quicker through the air and pushed back to the bowler
chips down  the track and he drives straight to short mid-off
flatter one and he works it to midwicket
gives it more air and he drills it down to long-on

the finger went up immediately! Amla wants to review  the lbw, Dilshan was bowling round the wicket, the ball kept low, landed on middle stump, Amla was trapped on the back foot, no sign of an inside edge, Hawkeye showed that crashing on off and middle stumps, plumb
stays back and knocks it towards long-on
he pushes it down to long-on
goes back and works it away wide of midwicket
gets forward and drives wide of short mid-off and down the ground
tries to drive wide of the bowler but Dilshan sprints across and cuts it off
gets forward and pushes it to long-off
comes forward and pushes it to long-on
chips down the track and works it wide of mid-on
stays back and punches it wide of cover
he comes well forward and blocks it out
down the track and he works it to midwicket

Dilshan proving to be trump card here for SL! De Villiers took a risk with the paddle sweep and it didn't come off well, Dilshan continues round the wicket to the right-handers, de Villiers shuffles about before delivery to distract the bowler, tries to paddle it and the ball lobs off the face of the bat to the keeper Sanga who was 100% certain de Villiers was gone, the umpire was convinced too
gets forward and pushes it to the on side
drives back to the bowler
lunges forward and works it down to long-on
tries to play it late and he chops it to the off side
comes well forward and defends
chips down the track and drives to mid-off
goes across his stumps and paddles it away to fine leg
comes well forward and pushes it to long-off
flatter one and Faf plunges forward to defend
flatter one and Faf pushes it to cover, Duminy sets off and heads back
good running, drops it in front of cover and sets off
flatter delivery and he pushes it to cover
on the pads and works it to the on side
flatter one and he clips it to midwicket
flatter and shorter and he can only clip it to square leg
begins a new spell with a slower ball which Duminy defends
a bit too close to cut and he chops it to Dilshan at point
tucks him up for room and he punches it straight to mid-off
turning out to be a quiet over, Duminy trying to break free but he ends up hitting it hard to cover
another slower ball and Duminy struggling with his timing, chopped down to point
he timed this one well this time but found short extra cover, maiden by Mathews and an improvement from his first spell
gets forward and paddles it to the on side
stays back and punches it to long-on
works it down the ground
tries to cut but ends up chopping it to the off side
chops it to the off side
flatter delivery and he pushes it down the ground to long-on
stays back and knocks it back to the bowler
that's exactly what Duminy needs to do more, forced just wide of mid-on and he calls early for the run
punched firmly and well stopped at extra cover
stays back and he punches it back to the bowler
slower ball on the pads and he clips it to midwicket
risky run! Faf chopped it towards point and Duminy called first and set off, Faf had to hurry and the throw to his end was wide
clips it down to midwicket
nudges it to the leg side for a single
and finally a boundary! Dilshan fires this on the pads and Duminy was in position early for the sweep, beats short fine leg
chips it in the air down to the vacant mid-on area, intentional
stays back and punches it  back to the bowler
that was good to watch! It was the cutter from Mathews and Faf wasn't foxed by that, chipped down the track and lofted it down the ground, straight as it can get, one bounce and over the rope
pushes it towards long-on
tries to work it to the on side and mistimes it
pushes it wide of cover for a single
Dropped by Mathews! Faf stabbed at one too early and played it low back to the bowler, Mathews was behind it but failed to pluck that one on his follow through, that will go down as a chance
stays back and works it wide of square leg
appeal for an lbw, round the wicket, may have pitched a shade outside leg, hitting him too high and appeared to be going down leg
works it down to deep square leg
drives firmly and a fumble at mid-on gives Duminy his fifty, his slowest ever in ODIs
drills it down to long-on
how did that suddenly take off! Turn and bounce on a length on the off stump, beat the batsman and Sanga, Thisara pulls it back before the rope
clips it down to deep square leg
bit of reverse swing, shows the full face of the bat and drives down the ground to long-on
gives him a bit of width and he chops it down to point
aims for the fuller one and he squirts it out to long-off
looked like the cutter, dabs it to point and tells his partner to wait
that's a sharp bouncer, Faf wasn't quick enough to hook and it fizzed past the helmet, he was down on his knee as it passed him
this is a low full toss and he clips it down to deep square leg
stays back and he chops it back to the bowler
down the track and checks his shot to midwicket
he works it down to cover
looped quicker towards middle and off and he plonks forward and defends
flatter one and he lunges forward to defend
good running, Faf tucked it wide of square leg and put pressure on the fielders by running the first hard
stays beside the line and chops it wide of point
slower ball, tucks him up for room and he chops it towards the keeper
fullish on the pads and Faf turns it quietly to the leg side
this was the shorter one and slower, he stays back and pulls
slower ball and he punches it wide of backward point
drives it down to long-on for a single and it's drinks
drifts on the pads and he knocks it to the on side
keeps a bit low and he manages to push it back to the bowler
chips down the track and he checks his shot back to the bowler

appeal for a stumping! Faf was lunging forward and beaten on the drive, turn and bounce, his back foot was in the air before dragging it back, Sangakkara got the bails off quickly, replays confirm that his foot was in the air and Faf du Plessis has to go, sharp stumping and good bowling too
fullish on the pads and he works it to midwicket
goes back at the crease and chops him down to cover

through his defenses! Mendis has sent back the dangerous Miller, the legbreak foxed him there, it was quicker and flatter and Miller was forward to defend, didn't read the turn, left a gap between pad and bat
Behardien ensures he covers the line before defending

reward for smart captaincy! For the bowling change and field placement. The short leg was placed before Behardien took strike, it was on a good length and he was looking to clip it to the on side, straight off the bat and Thirimanne takes in clean
and he's beaten straight away, skids and that wasn't far from the stumps
he bowls it too short and he rocks back and cuts him wide of point
defends forward but very close to the pads
works it to the on side very close to the pads
quicker one on the leg stump and he's happy to defend
drifts on the pads and he works it fine
stays back and punches it a bit late down to deep point
goes back and punches it hard back to the bowler
spins back in and he nudges it to the off side
gets a long way across to the off side and paddles him down to fine leg
this was flatter on the pads and he sweeps and connects well, finds deep square leg
that's a loose one from Mendis, low full toss on the pads and worked away wide of midwicket
stays back and he punches it wide of cover point
comes round the wicket and he knocks it down to midwicket
he goes back and he punches it down to point
he goes back at the crease and knocks it wide of point
tossed up and he works it with the turn down to deep midwicket
full outside the off stump and he drives him wide of cover
on the pads and he works it down to fine leg
plonks forward and defends
starts off with a short one and he pulls to deep midwicket, Chandimal fumbles

the bottom edge! Malinga bowled him another short one, this one wide outside off stump, Peterson went for the pull  but was a bit too early on the shot, looked ungainly, got the bottom edge and it dipped towards Sangakkara who took it easily in the end
aims for the yorker first up and he lands it on the spot but Kleinveldt does well to jam it out
a slower yorker this time and he tried to hammer it down the ground, Malinga boots it away
follows it up with a fizzy bouncer, the batsman did well to move out of the way
slower delivery and he tries to muscle it to the on side but mistimes it to midwicket
drifts on the pads and he knocks it to the on side
it was the googly and he got an inside edge to his pads as he looked to drive
he goes right back at the crease and defends
fullish on the pads and chipped on the up towards mid-on
stays back and punches to the off side for a single

the first of the match! Tossed up, Kleinveldt lofted it over wide long-on and there was a chance of him getting caught, Tharanga caught it but his foot stepped on the rope, he tossed it up hoping to take it on the second attempt inside the rope but it was too late
outside off and he pushes it down to third man
fires it full outside off and he drives hard and short extra cover dives a saves an extra run
full outside off and he drills it down the ground to long-on

can SA bat out their 50 overs? This was a slower ball, short as well, Kleinveldt remained in the crease and looked to flat-bat it over the infield, got a top edge that swirled to point where Dilshan took an easy catch jogging forward
this was on a good length outside off, cut him down to point
fires a yorker outside off and he squirts it out to point
he comes well forward and blocks it out
he waits on it and dabs it late down to third man

that was quite plumb! This was the flatter one, straightened after pitching, Morkel was forward to defend but the ball skidded and struck the base of the pads in front of middle, the umpire didn't spend much time mulling over it
lunges forward and gets an outside edge past slip
gets forward and drives straight to mid-off
sticks his pad out and pads it away
Duminy's doing just that, smashed a full delivery to long-off and turned down the single
he makes a bit of room and slogs a low full toss down to mid-on, looked like he set off for the run, decided against it
fires that full outside the off stump and Dilshan dives at backward point to stop that, beats him and they take the second
lovely improvisation! Duminy walks across his stumps for a premeditated sweep, he forces it away in front of square and finds the big gap, nobody in sight to cut that off
moves across and works a low full toss to midwicket, they hurry the single
Tsotsobe safely drills out a quick full one back to the bowler
Duminy states his intent by chipping down the track and lofting him over midwicket
tossed up and he lunges forward and defends
Lopsy too wants to chip down the track to see where it takes him, lobs off the pads and drops to the off side
safely knocks it to the on side to give Duminy the strike
this last-wicket stand might be annoying the hosts a bit! Flatter one and Duminy was on his knee quickly and slogged him clean over deep midwicket
good over for SA, pushes a full ball down to long-off to keep the strike
Duminy looks to slog over midwicket but fails to make contact with a yorker that just misses the off stump
these are very valuable runs indeed, Malinga looks for the yorker but it's a low full toss that Duminy hammers wide of midwicket
makes room and bashes it on the up down to long-off and he turns down the single
good yorker from Malinga, fast one outside off and JP tries to run it to third man but misses
Malinga proving expensive here, attempted yorker and it's a low full toss which he slogs over mid-on, no protection in the deep
well done JP, drills the last ball down to long-off and keeps the strike, SA past 230 already
chips down the track and checks his shot to midwicket after Mendis bowls it a touch short
getting closer to a century! Tossed up and he gets on his knee and slams it clean over wide long-on
he stays back and punches it down to long-on and turns down the single

it ends on 97 what a pity! Mendis fires in a quick one and Duminy tries another slog - the shot that has fetched him plenty of valuable runs in the last few overs - Mendis really got that leg break to turn sharply, ended up hitting the leg stump, finishes with 4

inn2.comm: he drifts on the body and he tries to work it to the on side, hit on the body
drifts towards the body and he nudges it down to fine leg
nervy start for Jayawardene! Extra bounce outside off and he pushes at it and gets an outside edge that drops short of second slip and runs to third man
beautiful delivery there, seams away and bounces and beats the outside edge
lands it outside off and it straightens before reaching the keeper
stays back and punches it to the off side
starts off by overstepping, pushes it to the off side
Free Hit : Dilshan clears his front leg and gets on his knee and slogs him over midwicket, bowls length and smashed
this one bends in slightly and he ensures he gets enough bat on it to flick it to the off side, candidate for lbw had that struck the pads
he chases at one that moves way, tries to cut and misses
fires the fuller one on the stumps and Dilshan manages to squirt it out
this was full and wide outside off and driven square down to third man
keeps it outside off and moves away and he safely leaves it alone
nips back in and he tries to work it away to the on side, inside edge to the body
he sprays it down the leg side, looks like Morkel's trying to get him to play across the line but he needs to target his stumps for that
this is more like it for Morkel, hits him on the pads as he tries to flick, stifled appeal but that was missing leg
this was a short one down the leg side and Dilshan went for the pull, misses it but wide enough to be penalised
this time he lands it outside off and he safely leaves it alone
solidly pushed to cover off the middle of the bat
this was slightly slower and he comes forward and pushes it to cover
turning out to be a long over, this was too wide outside off
and Dilshan gives them a half chance, pitched up a bit further and he goes for the drive and misses
wonderful delivery to MJ! Just shapes away, he walked across to cover the line but the ball fizzed past the edge
he moves across and gets an outside edge to slip, did well to keep it down
this was shaping away a bit too much, easy for Jayawardene to slice it wide of slip and down to third man
gets it shape across him and safely left alone to the keeper
gets forward and across and pushes it softly towards cover
fullish on the off stump and he pushes it to cover
stays beside the line and pushes it to the off side
bowls it in channel outside off and he leaves it alone, the ball holds its line
this was just down the leg side, he shuffled to nudge it away and Morkel appealed, wide not called
Jayawardene gets a bit impatient and chases a full one, nearly edges it to the keeper
on a good length outside off and he leaves it alone
much better over from Morkel, a maiden, he goes back and defends
keeps it full and he comes forward and defends this one
he swivels on the back foot and pulls and the fielder at square leg does well to slide and stop this one
this one angles across him and he reaches out and angles it to third man
Jayawardene should have put this away, short and wide outside off and he slaps it straight to point
fullish on the pads and he clips it on the up towards mid-on
good length outside off and he stays back and chops it to the off side
Morkel strays on the body again and he works it with the angle to the leg side off his pads
he teases him with a short one, a bouncer, Mahela tries to slash this over the slips but he was beaten for pace and bounce
tries to nudge it to the leg side and he knocks it to the leg side off his pads
short and wide outside off and Dilshan gives it everything, thrashes it wide of backward point and there was enough mileage to reach the rope despite the fielder getting a hand to it
once again Morkel strays down the leg side

good attempt at the boundary though, this was outside off and the edge went past second slip, Peterson dived at third man and the umpire called for assistance because the fielder was inches from the rope
tries to flick this one but misses
this was short and Jayawardene pulls but mistimes it, enough to clear square leg though
tries to flick it across the line but he finds midwicket
this time Dilshan flicks it just wide of the mid-on fielder to pick up a single
good length outside off and he safely defends it
pushes it with soft hands towards point and looks for a single but decides against it
top shot, this was pitched up on the off stump and it was the length for Jayawardene to loft off the front foot, launches it over midwicket, one bounce and four
that was a good ball, Dilshan was beaten was pace and extra bounce as he tried to slash through the off side
full on the off stump and he drives straight to mid-off
maybe a bit too close to cut, he ended up chopping it to the off side
that was bashed! Kleinveldt bowled that short and it looked like Dilshan was expecting that length, read it early, swiveled and pulled with force in front of square
the bowler did well to pitch that up and tuck him for room, went for the cut and nearly edged it to the stumps
gets beside the line and pushes it to the off side
another exquisite shot by Jayawardene, on a good length and straightens, Jayawardene merely plays through the line and chips it over the umpire, straight down the ground
Lopsy bowls it short but the umpire penalises him for that bouncer, the batsman withdrew the shot

sharp catch and good field placement too! Tsostobe gets it to angle across and gets some extra bounce, Jayawardene tries to run it square of the wicket towards third man but Amla was stationed at gully, it traveled quickly and he did well to fall to his left and take the catch
drifts on the pads and he tucks it to the on side
he stays right behind the line and defends this one
good length outside off and he gets across and defends
full and wide outside off and he chases it and misses
this too was a bit wide and he cuts him wide of backward point
lands outside leg and skids through and hits the pads, stifled appeal
Sanga chases a full and wide one and he ends up mistiming it back to the bowler
this was a half volley outside off and he chases it and times the cover drive well but can't beat the infield
good length on the pads and he whips this one to midwicket
stays back and he works it to the on side
another powerful pull, Peterson errs by dropping short, he goes on the back foot and pulls and keeps it low, past midwicket
he pushes this one towards cover
shuffles and works it to the on side
goes back and pushes it to long-on
drives down the track and Peterson moves across and stops it
edged but a tough chance! Outside edge on the drive and Amla flung himself to his left and got a hand to it, would have been a stunner
stays back and defends
he gives him too much width outside off and he plays a stylish cover drive to sweeper cover
pitches it up and he drives him straight to extra cover
pitches it up again and he firmly pushes it towards mid-off
fullish in length outside off and he pushes it towards cover
stays back and drives down the track
uses his feet and pushes it through the line down to long-on
skids through and he makes room and punches it back to the bowler
goes back and makes a hint of room and punches it to deep cover
appeal for a caught behind! He had the width but the ball wasn't short enough to cut, de Kock was quite confident, they decide not to use the review
stays back and punches it back to the bowler
stays back and pushes it back to the bowler
punched to the off side and he can't beat cover
fullish on the pads and he works it towards midwicket
opened the face of the bat and ran it down to third man, the umpire just about managed to get out of the way of the throw
clips this one to midwicket
he works it just wide of midwicket for a single
skids through and he plonks forward and defends
not afraid to make room, slices it wide of point

chance for a run out but a lousy throw! This was pushed down towards mid-off and the bowler dived and the ball deflected to mid-off, Sanga set off, Dilshan sent him back, he had to scamper back but the throw from Amla was so wide that de Kock had little chance, the ball goes to fine leg
fuller in length outside odd and he pushes this one down to mid-off
this looked deliberate Kleinveldt didn't give him much room and yet he made of that little width and angled it wide of slip and beats third man, used the pace on the ball
good length outside off and he gets well forward and pushes it to the off side
this was full and wide outside off and driven straight to cover
keeps a bit low and he manages to dig it out
fullish on the pads and driven back to the bowler
works a full ball wide of mid-on
goes back at the crease and works it wide of square leg
clips it just wide of square leg and Sanga sets off, Dilshan has to hurry but a better throw was needed to the keeper's end
turns it towards square leg and this time the coordination between the batsmen is better
comes round the wicket and tempts him with width, he chases it and nearly edges it
softly clips it away behind square on the on side
slower through the air and defended on the front foot
almost a run out! Sanga turned this towards short square leg and Dilshan set off, AB picked up and threw at the bowler's end, Dilshan came in the way, there was no single in the first place
pushed it to cover
gets forward and works it to the on side
stays back at the crease and cuts wide of point
slower through the air and Sanga aims to slog over deep midwicket, plays too early and the ball clips his body and rolls away
stays back and punches it down the track

did that really carry? Sangakkara go down on his knee and slogged him to deep midwicket, on normal speed it looked like it bounced before the rope but the umpire jumped the gun and signaled a six, he changed his decision
sweeps and fine leg runs across and cuts it off
stays back and knocks it towards square leg
on the pads and he clips it to deep square leg
shapes to cut but the ball skids through and beats the edge
drives down the track and Duminy dives and gets a hand to it and deflects to mid-off
tucks it to the on side
works it down to long-on
pushes it down to cover for a single
moves across his stumps and he works it to the on side
this one turned and beat the outside edge! An excited Peterson thought he might have had him, good delivery
tossed up and he plonks forward and defends
stays beside the line and pushes it to the off side
flatter delivery and he clips it to the on side
flatter delivery and he gets forward and pushes it to the off side
skids through and he gently tucks it towards square leg
slower through the air and he drills it down to long-on
gives him width outside off and he cuts to deep point
bowls it quicker and gets some turn, Sanga withdraws the shot
tossed up outside off and he drives him down to long-off
brings  up the 50 stand with a six! Tossed up and he comes down the track and lofts him over long-off
drills it down to long-on for a single
he stays back at the crease and punches it down to sweeper cover
on the pads and he clips it down to deep square leg
tossed up and he comes forward and he drives down to cover
quicker delivery and he gets an inside edge to the on side
angles across him and he pushes this towards point
short of a length and he gets across and defends
Morkel gets one to come back and it bothers Sangakkara, the ball misses the inside edfe
drifts on the body and he stays back and tucks it to the on side
he bangs it in short and he swivels and pulls and deep square leg picks up
a touch risky there as he chases one moving away and angles it wide of slip
confident appeal for an lbw! Landed on middle and off and skidded, hit on the pads and the umpire must have thought it was missing leg, Hawkeye shows that hitting the stumps...oh well!
oopsy! Fires that down the leg side, beats everyone
comes well forward and drives back to the bowler
comes forward and defends back to the bowler
stays back and he cuts this one wide of point
tossed up and he gets well forward and defends
keeps low and he tucks this one down to midwicket
Morkel angles it across Sanga and he leaves it alone
half volley outside off and he drives him well but short cover does well to get a hand to it
Dilshan brings up his fifty with a sound square cut! This was short and wide outside the off stump and he slapped wide of the vacant point region, third man can't mop up
angles it inwards and Dilshan looks to work it across the line and he's hit on the body
fullish in length outside off but he turns the bat and mistimes the drive to mid-off
flatter delivery and he works it towards midwicket
flatter one and he pushes it down the track
he mistimes the cut towards cover
full in length on the pads and driven down to long-on
drag this a bit short and Dilshan pulls but finds deep midwicket
good running, Dilshan pushed this softly in front of cover and immediately set off
stays behind the line and punches it to the off side
he bangs it in short and Sanga swivels and pulls him to deep square leg
stays beside the line and he punches this one down to cover
drifts on the pads and he gets an inside edge down to fine leg, Tsotsobe does well there to slide and save runs
tucks it just wide of mid-on and sets off but decides against the single
starts off with a generous offering outside off, half volley wide outside off, he drives him wide of point who slides in vain, the off side ring is more populated now
on the pads and clipped to the leg side
drifts down the leg side and wide called
too full on the pads and he clips it behind square
fullish outside off and driven wide of mid-off
we have seen plenty in this innings, this was far too wide down the leg side
he stays back and pushes it to the off side
strays on the pads and he works it down to long leg, bad start for Behardien, will he get another?
tucks it off his pads towards short fine leg
works it towards square leg
clips a low full toss back to the bowler
drops it with soft hands to the off side
tucks it away off his pads
down the leg side and he aims to sweep
too close to cut, chops it towards slip
drifts on the pads and he works it behind square
gets away with a false shot, this was short and Sanga went for the pull and miscued it, the top edge landed safely behind mid-on
well that's more like it, short again and Sanga swivels and pulls in front of square this time, down to deep midwicket
gets forward and drives a full delivery just wide of Tsotsobe at mid-off and he reaches his fifty!
short and wide and he slashes on the up wide of backward point and third man is square, he picks it up
chips down the track and he checks his punch to the on side
stays back and he cuts behind square on the off side
floated down the leg side and he sweeps to fine leg
works it down to backward square leg
Duminy continues round the wicket, fires that full and he sweeps to deep square leg
full on the off stump and he drives this one to mid-on
shorter in length and he mistimes the pull to mid-on
he struggles with his line and strays down the leg side
goes back and across and he tucks it away down to the on side

that was very well placed, Sangakkara moved across his stumps early to cover the angle by Kleinveldt, it was coming across him, he gently tickled it down to fine leg and deep square leg couldn't stop it
stays back and punches it back to the bowler
comes forward and defends to the off side
stays back and he works it to the leg side
goes back at the crease and he punches it to the off side
flatter delivery and he works it to midwicket
clips a low full toss down to long-on
flatter delivery and he plonks forward and drives to mid-on
full outside off and he drives down to sweeper cover
gets beside the line and he slices this one down to point
fullish in length outside off and he comes forward and drives towards long-off
nicely done, dabs it to the off side and sets off
used his wrists well there, this was drifting on the pads and he shuffled across and worked it down to deep square leg, no protection there
stays beside the line and he slices it wide of point for a couple
expensive start to the Powerplay, none of Lopsy's lengths are effective, this time he resorts to a short ball and Sanga swiveled and pulled him along the turf wide of square leg
lazy cut from Dilshan, didn't move his feet and he missed it completely
fullish in length and he comes forward and pushes it to the off side
this was short of a length outside off and he pulls him straight but can't beat mid-on
fuller in length and he comes forward and defends
he knows where the spaces are, this was short and he pulled it and it was a few miles up in the air but dropped safe and rolled to the deep square leg rope
this was pitched up and he comes well forward and lofts this time over mid-off, nit perfectly timed but good enough
Sanga shows his intent by shuffling a bit and he punches a short one to sweeper cover
fullish and wide outside off and he comes forward and drives to sweeper cover
that was a crisp loft! Pitched up on middle and leg, Sanga went a pace or two forward and lofted him downtown, timed it well and cleared long-on
comes across and gets an inside edge to the pads
shuffles across and clips a full delivery to deep midwicket
the Dilscoop finally makes an appearance! Dilshan moves a long way across, exposes the leg stump, Tsotsobe feeds him a length ball on the stumps and he promptly sends it on its way to fine leg
stays beside the line and angles it down to square third man
Dilshan wants to get this done with quickly, swings his bat too early and the ball just shaves past the stumps
bangs it in short and he swivels and pulls to long leg, brings up the 150, a record for SL against SA in ODIs for any wicket
short again and he swivels and pulls to deep square leg

Tsotsobe wouldn't ever want to see a replay of that! This was pulled with force past square leg and Tsotsobe sprinted across from fine leg and had it covered, the ball slipped between his legs, lazy effort there
Dilshan wants to get there first, short down the leg side and he turns quickly at the crease and pulls to fine leg, this game's finishing fast
goes back at the crease and punches to cover
round the wicket, down the track, he miscues the shot to point

Tsotsobe has had a horror 20 minutes or so! Dilshan pulled a short one and Tsotsobe at square leg was very tentative getting to it, wasn't sure whether to even attempt a catch or not and the ball bounced over him and raced to the boundary
gets there with a boundary! Short down the leg side and he swivels and pulls down to fine leg, Dilshan leaps, he is delighted, doesn't he love Pallekele?
down the track and he checks his shot, Sanga steps out and heads back
down the track and he drives to long-off
at this rate Sanga may not get to a century! Plays the conventional scoop to fine leg, no point firing it down the leg side
scoops again but doesn't time it well, down to fine leg
he gets forward and drives back to the bowler
chips down the track and mistimes the straight drive
tossed up and he comes forward and drives wide of cover
Dilshan is more generous this time to his partner, quietly defends so he can give him strike for the next over
his intent is clear, Morkel bowls length outside off, mid-off is up, Sanga makes room and smacks it over the off side and down to wide long-on
Sanga makes room and walks across his stumps and unfortunately for him it strikes the pad and rolls to the on side
91 now, length ball outside off and Sanga thuds it down the ground down to long-off
too wide outside off and penalised
we won't see twin hundreds today! Morkel pitched it up further and Sangakkara went on his knee to smash it straight, gets a top edge and Kleinveldt runs to his left from mid-off and takes the catch
he strays wide down the leg side
stays back and punches it to the off side
gets one to straighten and beat the outside edge, too bad Morkel didn't bowl too many of those today
quicker delivery and he gets forward and defends
gets forward and drives straight to mid-off
shapes to cut but finds point
quicker one and comes forward and defends
opportunity there, he dropped this shorter and Thirimanne rocked back and ended up punching to short cover
defends forward and we have a maiden over in the midst of the carnage
everything going Dilshan's way, not too short to pull and yet he gets an inside edge that sneaks past the stumps
full on the pads and he clips this one to square leg
this was fractionally short and he pulled in front of square, the fielder just pulls back before the rope, the umpire checks
fires this one wide outside the off stump and Thirimanne doesn't offer a shot
fires this one short down the leg side and he swivels and pulls to fine leg
Dilshan seals a crushing win! Clipped off his pads to square leg and fitting Dilshan does the honours and Sri Lanka are 3-1 up and cannot lose the series
